Articles.Content:
So I was messing around in KSP, mostly practicing getting in to orbit and some deorbiting tomfoolery. And after repeated reverts to launch, started to have issues with my rocket hitting some invisible water pipe.

What foul magic is this?
Smells like foul mod magic.

What foul magic is this?

The water pipe's.

...a moment's inattention and it'll getchya.

Smells like foul mod magic.

The same thing happened in this thread where the only mod was MechJeb.

The same thing happened in this thread where the only mod was MechJeb.

Well we still haven't heard if this person has MechJeb or other mods installed, you never know, it just might not be a vanilla problem, but then again it might be, which is why we need information!
Hrms! Quite interesting. It's like the collision mesh wanders for the water tower next to the launchpad. I suspect that's what was hit.

The same thing happened in this thread where the only mod was MechJeb.

No mods here!

I'm guessing that it was caused by a disgruntled plumber, recently fired from the Kerbal Plumber Program. I think that's the first time I've seen Jeb look worried!
Water pipe is in Kerbal Space Program\KSP_Data\sharedassets10.assets file of the vanilla.

Well we still haven't heard if this person has MechJeb or other mods installed, you never know, it just might not be a vanilla problem, but then again it might be, which is why we need information!

If the issue occurs in a game where no mods are involved, then it demonstrates that mods are not causing the problem...

That said, it was back in April, and April was er...0.20?

To my knowledge, this is a known bug. After a sustained period of time in the flight screen, the pipes collision mesh migrates. I have seen this issue documented in many mission reports of people flying interplanetary SSTOs. Many of them have taken to landing at the island airfield because of it.

Another mystery! The Jedi Master is on the job!

THE CASE OF THE MYSTERIOUS WATER PIPE

the gremlins of KSP strike agen.

mores seriously try verifying the files if you have it on steam

or using the squad sight to grab clean copy of them and tell us if it happens agen.
Water pipe leads to the water tower by the launch pad.

Water pipe leads to the water tower by the launch pad.

Colonel Mustard in the library with the candle stick!

I run stock. I only had mechjeb installed a few times when it happened. So it happens any way. Tough not a problem in 0.21 for me so fare.

99.9% I run stock. Clean install and save didnt make a difference in 0.20. Use the windows version under wine in linux.

There have been other users reporting it in the K-prize thread to.

Its definitely a bug. The ods that people get the same problem from bad hardware, corrupted download etc is small in comparison to the ods of it being a simple bug. Back in 0.20 I could repeat this bug reliably.

Edited August 27, 2013 by pa1983
psst! stay away from the water pipe. pass it on.
that happened to me in vanilla on my mun landing
I think a game company's mascot doesn't like us being on his new turf.

Hrms! Quite interesting. It's like the collision mesh wanders for the water tower next to the launchpad. I suspect that's what was hit.

I once had a ship collide with the Statue (in the pyramid complex in the great desert) while the ship was in orbit... so I believe collision meshes can wander far afield in strange situations.

Edited August 27, 2013 by Brotoro

I once had a ship collide with the Statue (in the pyramid complex in the great desert) while the ship was in orbit... so I believe collision meshes can wander far afield in strange situations.

I remember this. That was awesome.

Does anyone else remember the Sierpinski terrain?

I think a game company's mascot doesn't like us being on his new turf.

Squad's mascot is a water pipe? I could have sworn it was Lt. Gen. Chimp....

Colonel Mustard in the library with the candle stick!

With the lead piping surely?

</literalminded>

Colonel Mustard in the library with the candle stick!

I would have used the rope, woulda made it easier to call it a sucicide.

Colonel Mustard in the library with the candle stick!

I guessed the pipe. Evidence was misleading.

I once had a ship collide with the Statue (in the pyramid complex in the great desert) while the ship was in orbit... so I believe collision meshes can wander far afield in strange situations.

That was the best thing ever on these forums. The real kicker? At the end, we found out that it WASN'T the statue...
